Please wait for GPS signal. GPS does not work indoors.
Find NFC badge and place your phone on it

ČESTITAMO! You successfully finished the education trial and received badge
Amateur researcher of the education trail
You can pick up your badge at the information desk of Škocjan Caves Park.
Put away your phone. Near the next badge, your phone will alert you
Tick/Mark the pictures of birds living on precipitous walls
Tick/Mark the animals that use tree holes as their nest or for hunting
The common cuckoo (Cuculus canorus) lives in coniferous forests, deciduous forests, cultural landscape and wetlands
The European robin (Erithacus rubecula) nests among dense roots in the woods
The white stork (Ciconia ciconia) nests in open cultural landscape with access to rivers, wetlands and floodplains
The black-headed gull (Larus ridibundus) inhabits standing water bodies near human settlements
100 years ago, this place was less covered by trees
In the past, Kras was less covered by trees because of grazing and regular mowing. Move slider form left to right.
The Eurasian eagle-owl (Bubo bubo) commonly uses high, dry and broken steep walls for daily resting and nesting
The common swift (Apus apus) nests in high buildings; bell towers, under roof tiles, towers
The common redshank (Tringa totanus) nests in wet meadows with low vegetation and on coastal salt marshes
Does the figure shown in the picture belong in a pond?
The goldfish is an invasive species and presents a threat to other native species.
The red-eared slider is an invasive species that with nesting supplants the autochthonous species of turtle, the European pond turtle.
Construction material does not belong in the pond, because it destroys the habitat of many animal and plant species.
Caves are an important living environment for some plant and animal species.
There is no light in the underground, therefore plant species cannot grow there.
The fastest predator in the world is the cheetah.
The fastest predator is the peregrine falcon (Falco peregrinus), that reaches 320 km/h when praying on other birds.

This application only works on Educational Trail Škocjan.

STEP 1
Turn on data connection.

STEP 2
Leave the application open at all times.

STEP 3
Put the phone in your pocket and start your walk. When you get close to NFC badge, the phone will alert you by vibrating.

STEP 4
Find the NFC badge and scan it by placing your phone over the badge.

STEP 5
Play with content to unlock rewards. You answer the questions by dragging your finger to YES or NO, or by selecting relevant pictures.

Don't give up and continue to the end of the education trail. There are 8 titles to win!
The wind is caused mainly by air pressure differences.
Is the river Reka the longest subterranean river in Slovenia?
Hot air is raising because it has lower density then cold air cousing pressure differences in the atmosphere.
River Reka is the longest subterranean river in Slovenia. The river flows 50 km on the surface after which it submerges into the Škocjan cave system.
Wrong answer! You did not choose all pictures. (
